My **browser** is: Version 113.0.5672.126 (Official Build, ungoogled-chromium) (x86_64)

### Description

#### Background

#### Dockerfile

FROM node:20.5-alpine AS base
WORKDIR /app
COPY package*.json pnpm-lock.yaml /app
RUN apk add --no-cache git \
    && corepack enable \
    && pnpm config set store-dir /app/.pnpm-store \
    && pnpm config set package-import-method copy

FROM base AS prod-deps
RUN pnpm fetch --prod \
    && pnpm install --prefer-offline --ignore-scripts --frozen-lockfile --prod

FROM base AS build
COPY . /app
RUN pnpm fetch \
    && pnpm install --prefer-offline --ignore-scripts --frozen-lockfile \
    && pnpm build

FROM base AS deploy
COPY --from=prod-deps /app/node_modules /app/node_modules
COPY --from=build /app/dist /app/dist
EXPOSE 8080
CMD ['/bin/sh', 'start_compose.sh']

Issues.Title: $panel-block-active-border-left-color doesn't do anything
Issues.Body:
This is about **Bulma**.

### Overview of the problem

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**
I'm using Bulma **version** [0.9.4]
My **browser** is: Safari 
I am pretty sure this issue is **not a duplicate**.

### Description

$panel-block-active-border-left-color never actually gets applied to panel-block items with ```.is-active```

This is likely due to the fact that only border-bottom gets a border specified.

Indicating border-left-color only doesn't do anything unless border-left-style is also specified (and ideally border-left-width as well, but not required for the border to show).

Recommendation is to rename the variable $panel-block-active-border-left-color to $panel-block-active-border-left then update the reference such like:

```$panel-block-active-border-left: 1px solid $link !default```


Which would make it consistent with ```$panel-tab-border-bottom```

```css
.panel-block
  {...}
  &.is-active
    border-left: $panel-block-active-border-left
```

Another option would be to do the following in your custom CSS if you let the variable as-is:

```css
.panel-block.is-active {
  border-left-style: solid;
  border-left-width: 1px;
}
```

If the above expectation is the case I would just remove the variable all together and any references to it because it doesn't take much to add in another line in that case indicating the border-left-color.


```css
.panel-block.is-active {
  border-left-style: solid;
  border-left-width: 1px;
  border-left-color: $link;
}
```

IMHO this doesn't look good when you have a panel that colored ```.is-primary``` when your left border is $link and the text color is also $primary.


```css
.panel
  border-radius: $panel-radius
  box-shadow: $panel-shadow
  font-size: $size-normal
  &:not(:last-child)
    margin-bottom: $panel-margin
  // Colors
  @each $name, $components in $panel-colors
    $color: nth($components, 1)
    $color-invert: nth($components, 2)
    &.is-#{$name}
      .panel-heading
        background-color: $color
        color: $color-invert
      .panel-tabs a.is-active
        border-bottom-color: $color
      .panel-block.is-active
        border-left-color: $color
        border-left-style: solid
        border-left-width: 1px
      .panel-block.is-active .panel-icon
        color: $color
```


Might have been the original intention.

### Steps to Reproduce

Create a page with a panel or use the example in the docs with one panel-block which also has the class ```.is-active```

### Expected behavior

I assume that the intention is for there to be a 1-2 px border on the left the same color as $link

### Actual behavior

See that there's no border-left discernible on the panel-block which is also .is-active


Here's the pen: https://codepen.io/dogtoe/pen/zYMgoOx
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "$panel-block-active-border-left-color doesn't do anything" (#3670)

Issues.Title: Unable to select to copy source code in an embedded Github gist
Issues.Body:
This is about **Bulma**.

<!-- Is it about Bulma or about the Docs? -->
<!-- Is it a bug/feature/question or do you need help? -->
<!-- If it's a bug, is it a browser bug? -->

### Overview of the problem

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**
I'm using Bulma **version** 0.9.4.
My **browser** is: Safari 17.0 (it's a beta, sue me).
This is not a **Sass/Scss** issue, it plagues the CSS version as well.
I am pretty sure this issue is **not a duplicate**.


### Description

Unable to select to copy source code in an embedded Github gist

This is because embedded Gists and the resulting source code which features syntax highlighting reference the filename of the Gist file itself and use a plethora of classes. Unfortunately one of these classes is simply "file" 

This is due to the .file class being extended unselectable in **/sass/form/file.sass**

```
.file
  @extend %unelectable
```


### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a web project
2. Include the Sass/Scss version of Bulma
3. Use the JavaScript widget code for Github Gists in your project, such as:

```
<script src="https://gist.github.com/f4f49495409d67d13884e4ab326837e4.js?file=aws-google-chart-example.js"> </script>
```

### Expected behavior

I expect to be able to select source code in an embedded Github Gist widget to copy and paste into another application. 

### Actual behavior

I'm not able to select source code to highlight. 

Here's a brief sample of some generated HTML code from the widget which references the ```file``` class.

Even more interesting, whatever CSS framework Github Gists uses also use the class ```my-2``` which conflicts as well, though not as much of a nuisance. 

```
<div id="gist114581779" class="gist">
    <div class="gist-file" translate="no">
      <div class="gist-data">
        <div class="js-gist-file-update-container js-task-list-container file-box">
  <div id="file-aws-google-chart-example-js" class="file my-2"> <!--  THIS LINE RIGHT HERE -->
    
    <div itemprop="text" class="Box-body p-0 blob-wrapper data type-javascript  ">

        
<div class="js-check-bidi js-blob-code-container blob-code-content">
```

You can play with a Codepen showcasing the issue here: 

https://codepen.io/dogtoe/pen/Poxrbdg
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Unable to select to copy source code in an embedded Github gist" (#3667)

Issues.Title: removed deprecated code in example
Issues.Body:
removed `window.event`.
replaced `keyCode` with `code`.

This is a documentation fix.

### Proposed solution

`window.event` and `event.keyCode` are deprecated.

 - windows.event

> Web developers are strongly encouraged to instead rely on the [Event](http://dom.spec.whatwg.org/#event) object passed to event listeners, as that will result in more portable code. This attribute is not available in workers or worklets, and is inaccurate for events dispatched in [shadow trees](http://dom.spec.whatwg.org/#concept-shadow-tree).

Removed `window.event` as we already accept an event, as suggested above.

- event.keyCode:

> You should avoid using this if possible; it's been deprecated for some time. Instead, you should use KeyboardEvent.code, if it's implemented.

Replaced `event.keyCode` with `event.code` as suggested above.

### Tradeoffs

According to the [documentation](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/KeyboardEvent/code#browser_compatibility), code is supported by all major browsers, so there should be no tradeoffs.

### Testing Done

Run the same code after changing the event listener, pressed escape, observed that the modal closed.

### Changelog updated?

No.

Issues.Title: Imroving the search on the Bulma web site - finding classes (e.g. is-64x64)
Issues.Body:
Let's start with the obvious, I love Bulma! Thank you for making it!

In the docs of Bulma there is an example showing the [box element](https://bulma.io/documentation/elements/box/) that uses a class `is-64x64`. I wanted to find out what other such classes can I use. So I typed in `is-64x64` in the search box, but there was no hit.

Then I tried `sizes` and got the link to [column sizes](https://bulma.io/documentation/columns/sizes/).

Finally (already while I was typing this), it occurred to me to try to search for `image`. That brought be to [elements image](https://bulma.io/documentation/elements/image/) where I found the answer.

It was a bit frustrating experience.  IMHO it would be better if 
1. searching for a class would lead to the explanation(s). e.g. searching for `is-64x64`  would lead to https://bulma.io/documentation/elements/image/
2. searching for "size" would show all the pages where size is discussed. So in addition to the column sizes it would also shoe the elements image page. (and maybe others if they also deal with sizes)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Imroving the search on the Bulma web site - finding classes (e.g. is-64x64)" (#3659)

Issues.Title: Navbar height should be 3.5rem by default
Issues.Body:
### Problem The variable `$navbar-height` is set to `3.25rem` (52px) by default. However the navbar height changes to `3.5rem` (56px) as soon as a button is added! ➡️ This poses a 4px problem **in the case of a fixed navbar** because the padding is calculated as follows : ```scss $navbar-height: 3.25rem !default html, body &.has-navbar-fixed-top padding-top: $navbar-height &.has-navbar-fixed-bottom padding-bottom: $navbar-height ``` #### Steps to reproduce : - Create a fixed navbar - Add buttons ```html
Link
Button
``` ### Proposed solution Change default navbar height from `3.25rem` to `3.5rem`. ```scss // sass/components/navbar.sass:6 $navbar-height: 3.5rem !default ```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Navbar height should be 3.5rem by default" (#3655)

Issues.Title: card-header-title: Inline html elements "swallow" adjoining whitespace.
Issues.Body:
This is about Bulma. I believe this is a bug, but I may incorrect or it may be easier to fix as documentation. ### Overview of the problem This is about the Bulma **CSS framework** I'm using Bulma **version** [0.9.4] My **browser** is: Google Chrome Version `113.0.5672.92 (Official Build) (arm64)` I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate** ### Description When inline elements are used as direct children of a `card-header-title`, they will disrupt the inline flow of text and erase any adjoining whitespace. There are workaround, but if the behavior is expected, it could use better documentation. ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Have a card with a title that includes html similar to the following: ```

Item matching search

``` 2. For example, see this [jsfiddle](https://jsfiddle.net/xwq92Lun/1/) 3. Observe the resulting whitespace ### Expected behavior There should be a single space between `Item` and `matching`: ### Actual behavior The word "Item" runs right into "matching" with no whitespace: ### Workarounds 1. One workaround is to wrap the contents of `card-header-title` in a separate element -- so that its children do not automatically become flex items. This causes extra markup, and is not mentioned anywhere in the documentation as a necessary step: ```

Item matching search

``` 2. Another workaround is to manually apply a `display: block` to `card-header-title`. e.g: ```

Item matching search

``` ### Thoughts on causes (& potential fixes) 1. This behavior occurs because of `display:flex` on `card-header title` ([link to code](https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/d2d3c3dd7f2e4076b84e63efc998252851913a72/sass/components/card.sass#L49)). One way to fix it would be to simply remove that line (and also `align-items: center` which would no longer be valid. However, this would break the ability to add `.is-centered` as mentioned in the [`0.5.3` changelog](https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/d2d3c3dd7f2e4076b84e63efc998252851913a72/CHANGELOG.md?plain=1#L1085). 2. If the expectation is that `card-header-title` is a _container for other elements that contain text_ and is not expected to contain text directly, the documentation should be updated to reflect this expectation. For example, the [Card component docs](https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/d2d3c3dd7f2e4076b84e63efc998252851913a72/docs/cyp/components/card.html#L8) could replace their `

Card header

` example with `

Card header

` I am happy to submit a PR for either approach, but would like guidance (especially since solution # 1 would break existing functionality and need a bit more work to be less disruptive).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "card-header-title: Inline html elements "swallow" adjoining whitespace." (#3650)

Issues.Title: Select size broken without "multiple" attribute
Issues.Body:
This is a **Bulma** bug. ### Overview of the problem This is about the Bulma **CSS framework** I'm using Bulma **version** [0.9.4] My **browser** is: Google Chrome 112.0.5615.138 I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate**? I've tried searching, and didn't find a duplicate, maybe I missed it. ### Description Size attribute on a select element doesn't show multiple options, and doesn't hide the "V" icon. ### Steps to Reproduce With Bulma loaded, add this code to the HTML page: ```html
``` ### Expected behavior The select should show 3 options, same as without Bulma. It should show up as when using the "Multiple select" (from the documentation), but without the ability to select multiple options. ### Actual behavior It showed 1 option, with the "V" icon, and the scrollbar, with the second option slightly visible. It might have changed some dimensions too, not sure. Adding the "is-multiple" class to the div element removed the "V" icon. Adding the unwanted "multiple" attribute to the select tag fixes the display issues, but then the user is able to select multiple things.

I'm discovering the `<dialog/>` HTML element (see [specification](https://developer.mozilla.org/fr/docs/Web/HTML/Element/dialog)).

It would be nice if Bulma could provide a default styling so that we can use it with the modal component:

```html
<dialog class="modal" id="mymodal">
  ...
</dialog>
```

```javascript
const dialog = document.getElementById('mymodal');
dialog.showModal();
// ...
dialog.close();
```
